intro: Eremotropa, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Europe. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Eremotropa species are typically perennial herbs that thrive in dry, sandy soils. They are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
